CATAxisSystemAxisType (Enumeration)
enum CATAxisSystemAxisType {
  catAxisSystemAxisSameDirection,  catAxisSystemAxisByCoordinates,  catAxisSystemAxisOppositeDirection
} Specification of the axes of the coordinate system.
Values:
catAxisSystemAxisSameDirection= 0 Specifies that the axis direction is defined by a point, line, or plane.If the axis is defined by a point, the axis has the direction of the vector going from the origin of the coordinate system to the point.If defined by a line, the axis has the same direction as the line.If defined by a plane, the axis has the same direction as the normal vector of the plane.catAxisSystemAxisByCoordinates= 1 Specifies that the axis direction is defined by the three coordinates x,y,z of a vector.catAxisSystemAxisOppositeDirection
7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams
file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 17/827

--- PAGE 18 ---

= 2 Specifies that the axis direction is not specified or defined by a point, line, or plane.If the axis is defined by a point, the axis has the direction of the vector going from the point to the origin of the coordinate system.If defined by a line, the axis has the opposite direction of the line.If defined by a plane, the axis has the opposite direction of the normal vector of the plane.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CATAxisSystemMainType (Enumeration)
enum CATAxisSystemMainType {
  catAxisSystemStandard,  catAxisSystemAxisRotation,  catAxisSystemEulerAngles,  catAxisSystemExplicit
} Axis System type.
Values:
catAxisSystemStandard= 0 Specifies that the axis system is defined by an origin point and three axescatAxisSystemAxisRotation= 1 Specifies that the axis system is defined by an origin point, and a rotation around one axiscatAxisSystemEulerAngles= 2 Specifies that the axis system is defined by an origin point, and the three Euler anglescatAxisSystemExplicit=30 Specifies that the axis system is a datum.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CATAxisSystemOriginType (Enumeration)
enum CATAxisSystemOriginType {
  catAxisSystemOriginByPoint,  catAxisSystemOriginByCoordinates
} Axis System Origin.
Values:
catAxisSystemOriginByPoint= 0 Specifies that the origin point is put at the position defined by a geometric point. If no point si selected, the origin will be automatically put atthe intersection of the lines or planes defining the axes.catAxisSystemOriginByCoordinates= 1 Specifies that the origin point must stay at the position defined by three coordinates x,y,z.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

CATInteractionType (Enumeration)
enum CATInteractionType {
  CATSelection,  CATIndication,  CATMouseMove,  CATInputUndo,  CATInputRedo,  CATEscape,  CATOtherEditor,  CATExclusiveCommand
} Type of the interaction the user actually implemented.Role: This enum is used by interactive methods such as .
Values:
CATSelectionThe user selected a featureCATIndicationThe user indicated a location in a Window of the active EditorCATMouseMoveThe user moved the mouse pointerCATInputUndoThe user selected the Undo item of the Edit menuCATInputRedoThe user selected the Redo item of the Edit menuCATEscapeThe user pressed the Escape key. The user wants to cancel the script execution. The script must exit immediatelyCATOtherEditorThe user selected the Window (for example the title bar) of an Editor which is not the active Editor. The user wants to cancel the script execution.The script must exit immediatelyCATExclusiveCommandThe user selected an exclusive command. The user wants to cancel the script execution, the script must exit immediately.CAUTION: All scripts should, when an interactive method returns the CATExclusiveCommand value, sequentially:
do the necessary cleaningscall CSO.ActivateExclusiveCommandexit the script
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

CATMeasurableModeOfCalc (Enumeration)
enum CATMeasurableModeOfCalc {
  MeasExactCalculation,  MeasApproximateCalculation,  MeasExactElseApproxCalculation,  MeasUnknownCalculation
} Computation modeMeasure computation can be done in three modes : Exact else Approximate, Exact only or Approximate only.
In Exact else Approximate mode, the computation is done in exact if it's possible else in approximateIn Exact only mode, only exact results are given.In Approximate only mode, all results are approximate.
Values:
MeasExactThenApproxModeSpecifies the computation of the measure is done in exact if it's possible else in approximate.MeasExactModeSpecifies the computation of the measure is done in exact.MeasApproxModeSpecifies the computation of the measure is done in approximate.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CATMeasurableType (Enumeration)
enum CATMeasurableType {
  CAAMeasurableAxisSystem,  CAAMeasurableBetween,  CAAMeasurableCircle,  CAAMeasurableCone,  CAAMeasurableCurve,  CAAMeasurableCylinder,  CAAMeasurableLine,  CAAMeasurablePlane,  CAAMeasurablePoint,  CAAMeasurableSphere,  CAAMeasurableSurface,  CAAMeasurableVolume
} Type of the measurable to retreive.
Measure can be done on axis system, circle, cone, curve, cylinder, line, plane, point sphere, surface and volume, or between 2 elements.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

CATMultiSelectionMode (Enumeration)
enum CATMultiSelectionMode {
  CATMonoSel,  CATMultiSelTriggWhenSelPerf,  CATMultiSelTriggWhenUserValidatesSelection
} Types of multi-selection.Role: This enum is used by the method.
Values:
CATMonoSelMulti-selection is not supportedCATMultiSelTriggWhenSelPerfMulti-selection is supported (through a dedicated "Tools Palette" toolbar).The selection (through a trap for example) is triggered when the selection is actually performed.CTRL and SHIFT keys are not supported.CATMultiSelTriggWhenUserValidatesSelectionMulti-selection is supported (through a dedicated "Tools Palette" toolbar).The selection (through a trap for example) is triggered when the user validates the selection.CTRL and SHIFT keys are supported.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CATOpnsMeasureDistanceType (Enumeration)
enum CATOpnsMeasureDistanceType {
  catOpnsMinimumDistance,  catOpnsMaximumDistance,  catOpnsMaximumDistance12,  catOpnsMinimumDistanceAlongDir,  catOpnsBandAnalysis,  catOpnsUnknownDistance
} The different types of distance measure.It is used by the object to specify the measure type.
Values:
catOpnsMinimumDistanceThe computation measures the minimum distance between productscatOpnsMaximumDistanceThe computation measures the maximum distance between productscatOpnsMaximumDistance12The computation measures the maximum distance between products. The distance is measured normal to the selection.catOpnsMinimumDistanceAlongDirThe computation measures the minimum distance along the given directioncatOpnsBandAnalysisThe computation analyses the band between productscatOpnsUnknownDistanceThe unknown distance calculation type
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

CATStrCollarThrowOrientation (Enumeration)
enum CATStrCollarThrowOrientation {
  catStrCollarThrowOrientationInvert,  catStrCollarThrowOrientationNormal,  catStrCollarThrowOrientationCentered
} Define the Material Throw Orientation of Collar.This parameter indicates where the collar is placed compared to the Plate.
Values:
catStrCollarThrowOrientationInvertCollar is placed on the face of the Plate pointing backward Throw Orientation.catStrCollarThrowOrientationNormalCollar is placed on the face of the Plate pointing towards Throw Orientation.catStrCollarThrowOrientationCenteredCollar is placed centered with the Plate.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CATStrOpeningCreationMode (Enumeration)
enum CATStrOpeningCreationMode {
  catStrOpeningUndefined,  catStrOpeningOutputProfile,  catStrOpening3DObject,  catStrOpeningStandard,  catStrOpeningPartDesign,  catStrOpeningSlot
} Creation mode for the Opening.It can be:
Values:
catStrOpeningUndefinedThe opening creation mode is undefined.catStrOpeningOutputProfileThe opening contour is defined by an imbedded sketch (already positioned).catStrOpening3DObjectThe opening is defined by a solid, which may be specified directly, or implied by a closed surface or wire and an extrusion direction.catStrOpeningStandardThe opening is defined by a parametric contour sketch and positioning information.catStrOpeningPartDesignThe opening is a standard part design negative solid (hole, pocket or slot). This mode specifies that the opening is not defined as a Structure Modelopening, but is a part design part that serves as an opening.catStrOpeningSlotThe opening is a slot allowing the penetration of Profile into a Plate / Profile. Please note that this type of opening is not realized in SFD, we onlycapture the definition of it.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

CATStrProfileMode (Enumeration)
enum CATStrProfileMode {
  catStrProfileModeUndefined,  catStrProfileModePtLength,  catStrProfileModePtLimit,  catStrProfileModePts,  catStrProfileModeCrv,  catStrProfileModeSurf2Crvs,  catStrProfileModeSurfSurf,  catStrProfileModeOnOpening,  catStrProfileModeOnLimits
} Creation mode for profile.It can be:
Values:
catStrProfileModePtLength- ProfilePtLength: profile defined by a point, a direction and a length.catStrProfileModePtLimit- ProfilePtLimit: profile defined by a point, a direction and a limit.catStrProfileModePts- ProfilePts: straight profile between two points.catStrProfileModeCrv- ProfileCrv: profile on a curve and optionally a reference surface. a spec point type or a point on curve.catStrProfileModeSurf2Crvs- ProfileSurf2Crvs: profile by the intersection of a surface and two curves.catStrProfileModeSurfSurf- ProfileSurfSurf: profile define by the intersection of two surfaces.catStrProfileModeOnOpening- ProfileOnOpening: profile on the edges of a Panel Opening.catStrProfileModeOnLimits- ProfileOnLimits: profile on the edges of Panel limits.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

CatChamferMode (Enumeration)
enum CatChamferMode {
  catTwoLengthChamfer,  catLengthAngleChamfer
} Chamfer definition mode.A chamfer between two faces can be defined using two lengthes, or a length and an angle. The first length, or the single length, depending on the way thechamfer is defined, is measured on the reference face from the edge to chamfer to determine the first edge the chamfer creates on the reference face. Thisreference face is either the face selected or the face determined by CATIA if the edge to be chamfered was selected. The second length, or the angle,determines the second edge that the chamfer creates on the second face.
Values:
catTwoLengthChamferThe chamfer is defined using two lengthescatLengthAngleChamferThe chamfer is defined using a length and an angle
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CatChamferOrientation (Enumeration)
enum CatChamferOrientation {
  catNoReverseChamfer,  catReverseChamfer
} Chamfer orientation.Defines whether to keep the face selected or determined by CATIA as the chamfer reference face.
Values:
catNoReverseChamferThe chamfer reference face is the face selected or determined by CATIAcatReverseChamferThe chamfer reference face is the other face
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CatChamferPropagation (Enumeration)
enum CatChamferPropagation {
  catTangencyChamfer,  catMinimalChamfer
} Chamfer propagation mode.Once running on an egde, a chamfer operation may propagate onto other edges that extend the first one. This mode controls the chamfer ability to do so.
Values:
catTangencyChamferThe chamfer operation also chamfers any other edges found at the first edge extremities, as long as they are tangent with it. This process repeatsuntil no more tangent edges to chamfer are found at extremities of already chamfered ones.catMinimalChamferThe chamfer operation stops as soon as an edge to chamfer cuts one or the two chamfer created edges
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

CatConstraintAngleSector (Enumeration)
enum CatConstraintAngleSector {
  catCstAngleSector0,  catCstAngleSector1,  catCstAngleSector2,  catCstAngleSector3
} Special constraint property for angle constraints.
It only applies to the constraints of type Angle or PlanarAngle.The geometric elements of an angle constraint (e.g. : 2 lines or 2 planes) divide the sketch or the space in 4 regions which are called angular sectors, numberedfrom 0 to 3. By default, the constraint is created in the sector number 0. One angular sector corresponds exactly to particular values of the Dimension.Value,the Side and the Orientation. When changing the angular sector, the Dimension.Value, Side and Orientation are also modified. 1 / 0 ---/--- 2/ 3 By default, theconstraint is created in the sector number 0. One angle sector corresponds exactly to particular values of the Dimension.Value, the Side and the Orientation.When changing the angle sector, the Dimension.Value, Side and Orientation are also modified.
7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams
file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 36/827

--- PAGE 37 ---

Values:
AngleSector=0The default sector of a constraint. Dimension.Value = angle Orientation = catCstOrientSame Side = catCstSidePositiveAngleSector=1Dimension.Value = angle-180 if angle>180 abs(angle)+180 otherwise Orientation = catCstOrientOpposite Side = catCstSidePositiveAngleSector=2Dimension.Value = abs(540-angle) if angle>180 180-fabs(angle) otherwise Orientation = catCstOrientOpposite Side = catCstSideNegativeAngleSector=3Dimension.Value = 360-abs(angle) Orientation = catCstOrientSame Side = catCstSideNegative
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

CatConstraintDistConfig (Enumeration)
enum CatConstraintDistConfig {
  catCstDCUnspec,  catCstDCParallel,  catCstDCParallelSameOrient,  catCstDCParallelOppOrient
} Special constraint configurations for distance constraints.
When distance constraints involve lines or cylinders, the constrained elements can rotate around the line on which the distance is measured, while stillrespecting the distance constraint. This degree of freedom is in most cases not wanted.This enum is used to further qualify the distance constraint, so that such degree of freedom can be eliminated in case of need, without requiring another distinctconstraint to be defined.
Values:
catCstDCUnspecNo additional condition is set on the constraint.catCstDCParallelIn addition to being positioned at a given distance, constrained elements are required to be parallel. Their orientation can be the same or opposite.catCstDCParallelSameOrientIn addition to being positioned at a given distance, constrained elements are required to be parallel, and their orientations are required to be thesame.catCstDCParallelOppOrientIn addition to being positioned at a given distance, constrained elements are required to be parallel, and their orientations are required to beopposite.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes

CatConstraintMode (Enumeration)
enum CatConstraintMode {
7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams
file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 37/827

--- PAGE 38 ---

  catCstModeDrivingDimension,  catCstModeDrivenDimension
} Constraint working modePart constraints can work in two modes: as constraints or as measurements.
In constraint mode, the value assigned to the constraint drives the actual position of the constrained geometry.In measurement mode, the constraint value only reflects what can be observed from the actual position of the constrained geometry.
Values:
catCstModeDrivingDimensionSpecifies that a constraint should work as a constraint.catCstModeDrivenDimensionSpecifies that a constraint should work as a measurement.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CatConstraintOrientation (Enumeration)
enum CatConstraintOrientation {
  catCstOrientSame,  catCstOrientOpposite,  catCstOrientUndefined
} Constraint elements relative orientation.
When two geometrical elements are constrained, there is often a variety of relative positions and orientations of these elements that respect the constraint. Forinstance, if a distance constraint is placed on two planes, the second plane can lie on both sides of first plane while maintaining the requested distance: theconstraint is respected, but geometry remains unresolved. Furthermore, even if the side is fixed, second plane still can be oriented so that its normal pointstowards the first plane or in the opposite direction, without breaking the constraint.Managing such indetermination requires control over two variables:
Sidedetermines, when relevant, on which side of each other constrained elements should be positionnedOrientationdetermines, when relevant, how to orient constrained elements, whith respect to each other.
This enum deals with possibles options for dealing with the Orientation variable (see for possibles options for Side).
This enum is based on the notion of characteristic vector. A characteristic vector is a vector which is associated with a constrained element each time it can beassimilated to a line or a plane. The vector represents the direction of the line, or the direction normal to the plane.
Values:
catCstOrientSamespecifies that characteristic vectors associated to constrained elements have same orientation.catCstOrientOppositespecifies that characteristic vectors associated to constrained elements have opposite orientation.catCstOrientUndefinedspecifies that the relative orientation of characteristic vectors associated to constrained elements is not specified
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CatConstraintRefAxis (Enumeration)
enum CatConstraintRefAxis {
  catCstRefAxisX,  catCstRefAxisY,  catCstRefAxisZ
} Constraint reference axis.
Constraints that specify parallelism or perpendicularity to an axis in 3D are mono-element constraints. The axis to which the constraint applies is determinedby the constraint property ReferenceAxis. This enum lists appropriate values to set this property.
Values:
catCstRefAxisXThe constraint applies to the X axis.catCstRefAxisYThe constraint applies to the Y axis.catCstRefAxisZThe constraint applies to the Z axis.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams
file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 38/827

--- PAGE 39 ---

All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CatConstraintRefType (Enumeration)
enum CatConstraintRefType {
  catCstRefTypeRelative,  catCstRefTypeFixInSpace
} Constraint reference type.
In the PartDesign context, an element having a Reference constraint will not move during the update. The Assembly context allows two behaviours : Either theelement will not move, or the element will move to the position where it was when the Reference type has been set to FixInSpace. ReferenceType. This enumlists appropriate values to set this property.
Values:
catCstRefTypeRelativeThe element will not move during the update (the default mode).catCstRefTypeFixInSpaceThe element will move to its former position (Assembly context only).
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CatConstraintSide (Enumeration)
enum CatConstraintSide {
  catCstSidePositive,  catCstSideNegative,  catCstSideSameAsValue,  catCstSideOppositeToValue,  catCstSideUndefined
} Constrained elements relative side.
When two geometrical elements are constrained, there is often a variety of relative positions and orientations of these elements that respect the constraint. Forinstance, if a distance constraint is placed on two planes, the second plane can lie on both sides of first plane while maintaining the requested distance: theconstraint is respected, but geometry remains unresolved. Furthermore, even if the side is fixed, second plane still can be oriented so that its normal pointstowards the first plane or in the opposite direction, without breaking the constraint.Managing such indetermination requires control over two variables:
Sidedetermines, when relevant, on which side of each other constrained elements should be positionnedOrientationdetermines, when relevant, how to orient constrained elements, whith respect to each other.
This enum deals with possibles options for dealing with the Side variable (see for possibles options for Orientation).
This enum is based on the notion of characteristic vector. A characteristic vector is a vector which is associated with a constrained element each time it can beassimilated to a line or a plane. The vector represents the direction of the line, or the direction normal to the plane.
Values:
catCstSidePositiveFirst constrained element characteristic vector points towards second constrained element.Arithmetic sign of constraint value is ignored, only its absolute value is taken into account.catCstSideNegativeFirst constrained element characteristic vector points opposite to second constrained element.Arithmetic sign of constraint value is ignored, only its absolute value is taken into account.catCstSideSameAsValueArithmetic sign of constraint value specifies where second element lies with regard to first one: a positive value means in the direction of firstconstrained element characteristic vector, a negative value in the opposite direction.catCstSideOppositeToValueArithmetic sign of constraint value specifies where second element lies with regard to first one: a negative value means in the direction of firstconstrained element characteristic vector, a positive value in the opposite direction.catCstSideUndefinedRelative positionning of constrained elements is not defined.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CatConstraintStatus (Enumeration)
enum CatConstraintStatus {
  catCstStatusOK,  catCstStatusKOStronglyNotSatisfied,
7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams
file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 39/827

--- PAGE 40 ---

  catCstStatusKOWrongOrientOrSide,  catCstStatusKOWrongValue,  catCstStatusKOWrongGeomEltType,  catCstStatusKOBroken
} Possible state of a constraint.
Indicates whether a constraint is satisfied or not, along with a diagnosis when not satisfied.
Values:
catCstStatusOKThe constraint is satisfied.catCstStatusKOStronglyNotSatisfiedThe constraint is strongly not satisfied (e.g. distance constraint between two planes, which are not currently parallel).catCstStatusKOWrongOrientOrSideThe constraint is not satisfied because of the wrong orientation or side of its geometric elements (e.g. planes are parallel and at the specifieddistance, but their orientation is inverted with respect to the one specified by the constraint).catCstStatusKOWrongValueThe constraint is not satisfied because of its value (e.g. planes are parallel and at the specified orientation and side but not at the specifieddistance).catCstStatusKOWrongGeomEltTypeThe constraint is not satisfied because of the wrong type of its geometric elements (e.g. angle between a point and a plane). It can happen in anassembly when replacing a part by another.catCstStatusKOBrokenThe constraint is not satisfied because a geometric element is missing. It can happen in an assembly when a part is missing.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CatConstraintType (Enumeration)
enum CatConstraintType {
  catCstTypeReference,  catCstTypeDistance,  catCstTypeOn,  catCstTypeConcentricity,  catCstTypeTangency,  catCstTypeLength,  catCstTypeAngle,  catCstTypePlanarAngle,  catCstTypeParallelism,  catCstTypeAxisParallelism,  catCstTypeHorizontality,  catCstTypePerpendicularity,  catCstTypeAxisPerpendicularity,  catCstTypeVerticality,  catCstTypeRadius,  catCstTypeSymmetry,  catCstTypeMidPoint,  catCstTypeEquidistance,  catCstTypeMajorRadius,  catCstTypeMinorRadius,  catCstTypeSurfContact,  catCstTypeLinContact,  catCstTypePoncContact,  catCstTypeChamfer,  catCstTypeChamferPerpend,  catCstTypeAnnulContact,  catCstTypeCylinderRadius,  catCstTypeStContinuity,  catCstTypeStDistance,  catCstTypeSdContinuity,  catCstTypeSdShape,  catCstTypeCurvilinearDistance
} Possible types of constraints.According to their type, constraint may exist in 3D space (at the part level), in 2D space (at the sketch level), or both.
The constraint type also determines the number of elements (from 1 to 3) that are necessary to define the constraint, plus the type of those elements. Also, theconstraint type defines the valid combinations between those types, and the associated semantics.
These combinations plus usage notes are detailed in tables on a per-type basis below.
Values:

"Curve" means every possibletype except point

See for managing the relativeposition of constrainedelementsPoint Cylinder Constraint is measured along the line, perpendicular tocylinder axis, that contains point. Constraint value isequal to the distance between the point and the cylindersurface, measured along this line.

See for managing theplacement of point relative tothe normal to the sphere atprojection point....with lineLine Line Constraint is measured along the common perpendicularto both lines. Constraint value is equal to the distancebetween both lines measures on this perpendicular.
See for further specifyingparallelism conditions on lines.
Line Plane Line is parallel to plane, i.e. line lies within a planeparallel to plane. Constraint value is equal to distancebetween those planes.
See for managing the relativeposition of line and plane
Line Cylinder Same as Line/Line case, but constraint value is measuredbetween line and cylinder surface.See for managing on whichside of measurement point onfirst element is second elementlocated (relative to thedirection of normal to elementat that point). CatDrawingViewType (Enumeration)
enum CatDrawingViewType {
  catViewBackground,  catViewFront,  catViewLeft,  catViewRight,  catViewTop,  catViewBottom,  catViewRear,  catViewAuxiliary,  catViewIsom,  catViewSection,  catViewSectionCut,  catViewDetail,  catViewUntyped,  catViewMain,  catViewPure_Sketch,  catViewUnfolded,  catViewAxonometric
} Type of a view.
Values:
Background_ViewThe background view is the view in the background of the sheet. This view contains in general the frames and title blocks. There is a backgroundview per sheet.FrontViewThe front view is a front representation of a part.LeftViewThe left view is a left representation of a part regarding to the current standard.RightViewThe right view is a right representation of a part regarding to the current standard.TopViewThe top view is a top representation of a part regarding to the current standard.BottomViewThe bottom view is a bottom representation of a part regarding to the current standard.RearViewThe rear view is a rear representation of a part regarding to the current standard.AuxiliaryViewThe auxiliary view is a representation of a part regarding to an user defined projection planeIsomViewThe isom view is a isometric view of a part.SectionViewThe section view is a view of a part which is first sectionned regarding to a user defined profile. The part geometry beside the section plane isvisible.SectionCutViewThe section cut view is a view of a part which is first sectionned regarding to a user defined profile. Only the geometry in the section plane isvisible.DetailViewThe detail view is a view of a local area of the part. The area boundarie may be a circle or a polyline.UntypedViewThe untyped view is none of those typed views.Main_ViewThe main view is the view suporting geometries and annotations for a sheet. In other words, the main view is the default view of a sheet. There is amain view per sheet.Pure_SketchThe pure sketch is for internal uses only.UnfoldedViewTo specify an unfolded view of a part.AxonometricViewThe Axonometric view is a representation of a part regarding to an user defined projection plane
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

CatInterferenceComparison (Enumeration)
enum CatInterferenceComparison {
  catInterferenceComparisonNone,  catInterferenceComparisonRecomputeModify,  catInterferenceComparisonDeleteOutOfScope
} Interference Simulation type of comparison, these options allow or not the reuse of existing interference simulation results.
Values:
catInterferenceComparisonNoneNo reuse of existing interference simulation results.Previously computed interferences are removed from the simulation.catInterferenceComparisonRecomputeModifyReuse of existing interference simulation results. In this case, only the modified parts are computed.Previously computed interferences are kept.catInterferenceComparisonDeleteOutOfScopeThis option forces the selection of option: catInterferenceComparisonRecomputeModify.This option allows to remove from the simulation the interferences for which the validity status is "Out of Scope"
By default, Interference Simulation is created with the option: catInterferenceComparisonRecomputeModify.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

CatInterferenceComputeQuantifier (Enumeration)
enum CatInterferenceComputeQuantifier {
  catInterferenceComputeQuantifierMinimumDistance,  catInterferenceComputeQuantifierPenetrationVector
}
7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams
file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 65/827

--- PAGE 66 ---

Interference Simulation computation of quantifier, these options allow or not the computation of quantifier for interference
Values:
catInterferenceComputeQuantifierMinimumDistanceComputation of minimum distance between parts.This option has only effect when the result is a clearance.This option is only available if one of the following specifications is active:- standard computation with a computation of clearance (see: catInterferenceSpecificationTypeClearance in ).- engineering connections of type "Check Clearance" are taken into account (see: catInterferenceSpecificationTypeEngCnxCheckClearance in ).- knowledges rules are taken into account (see method: ).
catInterferenceComputeQuantifierPenetrationVectorComputation of vector of penetration.This option has only effect when the result is a clash.
Use method to check if the desired computation of quantifier is available.
By default, Interference Simulation is created without computation of quantifier.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

CatInterferenceGroupComputationType2 (Enumeration)
enum CatInterferenceGroupComputationType2 {
  catInterferenceGroupComputationTypeAllAgainstAllInGroup,  catInterferenceGroupComputationTypeGroupAgainstGroup,  catInterferenceGroupComputationTypeGroupAgainstContext,  catInterferenceGroupComputationTypeAllAgainstAllInContext
} Interference Specification groups.
The interference simulation may have followings types of groups:
Values:
catInterferenceGroupComputationTypeAllAgainstAllInGroup,The computation takes into account all the occurrences against each other inside groupscatInterferenceGroupComputationTypeGroupAgainstGroup,The computation takes into account all the occurrences in a group against the others in other group.catInterferenceGroupComputationTypeGroupAgainstContext,The computation takes into account all the occurrences of the first group against the rest of the context. In that case, the context is the root of oneoccurrence in the group.catInterferenceGroupComputationTypeAllAgainstAllInContext,The computation takes into account all the occurrences against each other inside context. In that case, the context is the root product.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

CatInterferenceSpecificationType (Enumeration)
enum CatInterferenceSpecificationType {
  catInterferenceSpecificationTypeNone,  catInterferenceSpecificationTypeClash,  catInterferenceSpecificationTypeClearance,  catInterferenceSpecificationTypeClashWithoutContact
} Interference Simulation Specification type of computation for the standard specification.
Values:
catInterferenceSpecificationTypeNoneNo use of standard specification.It means that the interference simulation uses:- engineering connection specification: see method with the option "No Check" unchecked (see: catInterferenceSpecificationTypeEngCnxNoCheckin ).- or knowledge rules specification (see method: ).catInterferenceSpecificationTypeClashThe standard specification is used and it is a clash + contact computation.catInterferenceSpecificationTypeClearanceThe standard specification is used and it is a clearance + contact + clash computation.catInterferenceSpecificationTypeClashWithoutContactThe standard specification is used and it is a clash + contact computation and only interferences of type "Clash" are kept.
By default, Interference Simulation is created with the type: catInterferenceSpecificationTypeClash
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes

file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 68/827

--- PAGE 69 ---

catInterferenceSpecificationTypeEngCnxCheckClearanceto take into account engineering connection specifications of type "Check Clearance".catInterferenceSpecificationTypeEngCnxNoCheckto take into account engineering connection specifications of type "No Check".If this value is the only value used for engineering connection specification, standard specification must also be used. In this case the value ofCatInterferenceSpecificationType must be catInterferenceSpecificationTypeClash or catInterferenceSpecificationTypeClearance.
When engineering connection specification is used, one or many following values can be used simultaneously:- catInterferenceSpecificationTypeEngCnxCheckNoClash- catInterferenceSpecificationTypeEngCnxCheckContact- catInterferenceSpecificationTypeEngCnxCheckClearance- catInterferenceSpecificationTypeEngCnxNoCheckSo, use method to specify the desired values or remove the catInterferenceSpecificationTypeEngCnxCheckNone value (see method: ) to activate allthese previous values.
By default, Interference Simulation is created with the type: catInterferenceSpecificationTypeEngCnxCheckNone

7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams

  catPrintQualityMedium,  catPrintQualityHigh,  catPrintQualityCustom
} Print quality.It is used by the object for document printing. The print quality ranges from catPrintQualityDraft to catPrintQualityHigh and applies to shaded images.catPrintQualityDraft is the lowest quality and creates images with the screen resolution (It is for example the Quality 0 for HP-GL/2.) catPrintQualityHighprints images at the maximum printer resolution. The other print qualities are somewhere in between.

CatScriptCommand (Enumeration)
enum CatScriptCommand {
  CatScriptCommandDefault,  CatScriptCommandStop,  CatScriptCommandStart
}
7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams
file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 78/827

--- PAGE 79 ---

ScriptCommand values.Used for property, itself used when performing Selection from script.
Values:
CatScriptCommandDefaultThe Select interactive command remains active during all the script execution. This is the default value.CatScriptCommandStopEnds the previously activated fake command. The fake exclusive command instanciated goes out of its sleeping state. This is also true for theshared command instanciated during the execution of . The Select command is instanciated and becomes active.CatScriptCommandStartInstanciates and activates a fake exclusive command:
the active command (the Select command in most cases) is deactivatedis emptied
Then, if the user selects an external exclusive command such as the Pad command, the fake exclusive command instanciated will enter a sleepingstate. If the user selects an external exclusive command during the execution of an interactive method such as , the shared command enabling theselection will also enter a sleeping state.Note: Setting this property will fail (being followed by a script error) if one of the following error occurs (CATIA.ScriptCommand current valueis... it cannot be set to...):
... CatScriptCommandDefault => CatScriptCommandDefault... CatScriptCommandDefault => CatScriptCommandStop
... CatScriptCommandStart => CatScriptCommandDefault... CatScriptCommandStart => CatScriptCommandStart
... CatScriptCommandStop => CatScriptCommandDefault... CatScriptCommandStop => CatScriptCommandStop... CatScriptCommandStop => CatScriptCommandStart
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes

CatSheetGenViewsPosMode (Enumeration)
enum CatSheetGenViewsPosMode {
  catFixedCG,  catFixedAxis
} Positioning mode values for generative views inside the sheet.The positioning mode for a given sheet determines the generative views position behavior when an update is requested. Notice: the position of generativeviews is usually the position of the image of the center of gravity of the 3D data.
catFixedCGthe position of the image of the center of gravity of the 3D data remains the same after an update.catFixedAxisthe position of the image of the center of gravity is modified so that existing geometries don't move after an update.

All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CatSolveType (Enumeration)
enum CatSolveType {
  ManualSolveType,  AutomaticOptimizedSolveType,  AutomaticCompleteSolveType
} Type for controlling the resolution in Knowledge Expert.
An optimized resolution is a resolution taking into account only the objects modified since the previous resolution.
A complete resolution is a resolution starting from scratch : nothing from the past is taken into account.
Values:
ManualSolveType0 : the complete resolution is not called when the part/product is updated.AutomaticOptimizedSolveType1 : the optimized resolution is called when the part/product is updated.AutomaticCompleteSolveType2 : the complete resolution is called when the part/product is updated.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes

WholeObjects0 : the rule base works on all the objects that are in session (even the objects inside the representation).OccurenceObjects1 : the rule base works on occurrences (leaf positionned instances) for clash rules for example.PLMObjects2 : the rule base only works on PLM Objects and their attributes.AllOccurenceObjects3 : the rule base only works on occurrences for implement link into RFLP.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
CtmBaseAxisOrientation (Enumeration)
enum CtmBaseAxisOrientation {
  AXIS_RELATIVE_VERTICAL,  AXIS_RELATIVE,  AXIS_RELATIVE_BISECTOR,  AXIS_ABSOLUTE
} Defines the reference axis definitions.
Legal values:
AXIS_RELATIVE_VERTICAL : Base defined relative to trajectory and kept vertical.AXIS_RELATIVE : Base defined relative to trajectory.AXIS_RELATIVE_BISECTOR : Base defined relative to trajectory and rotate half way towards the wallAXIS_ABSOLUTE : Base defined with station axis system.

see
Branch Nodes should be one of the following types.
delAstROOTTop level node of the entire AST tree.This is the only node type where position in the tree matters. All children of the root node are individual robot program files. The ID of each child nodeis the file name with extension.delAstFILERobot filedelAstMODULERapid MODULEdelAstTASKRobot taskdelAstCONTROLLERController informationFor example profile definitions, global position definitions, etc.delAstINSTRUCTIONSList of instructions.Each child of this node should be an instruction or comment.delAstPOSITIONSList of position definitions.Used in languages where positions definitions are done in the header or footer.delAstDECLARATIONSList of declarations.Each child of this node should be a declaration or comment.delAstPARAMETERSList of parameters.Each child of this node should be a task declaration parameter.delAstARGUMENTSList of argumentsEach child of this node should be a run argument.delAstSTATEMENTSList of statements.General purpose list of items.delAstHEADERA generic header or footer statementdelAstSTATEMENTUsed for branches where no other type applies.Often used for grouping a part of an instruction. When used in an instruction list this is a custom instruction.delAstMOTIONA robot motion instructiondelAstVARIABLEA variabledelAstRUNA task calldelAstIFAn IF blockdelAstELSEIFAn ELSEIF blockdelAstELSEAn ELSE blockdelAstENDIFend IF blockdelAstFORA FOR block
7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams
file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 99/827

--- PAGE 100 ---

delAstENDFORend FOR blockdelAstWHILEA WHILE blockdelAstENDWHILEend WHILE blockdelAstDOA DO UNTIL blockdelAstUNTILend DO UNTIL blockdelAstTESTstart TEST blockdelAstCASEA CASE blockdelAstCASEDEFAULTA DEFAULT CASE blockdelAstENDTESTend TEST blockdelAstGOTOA GOTO statementdelAstLABELA GOTO labeldelAstASSIGNAn assign statementdelAstRETURNA return statementdelAstWAITA wait statementdelAstEXPRESSIONAn expression.delAstGROUPEXPAn expression which has grouping (parentheses)delAstUNARYEXPAn expression with a unary operator (e.g. -x)delAstBINARYEXPAn expression with a binary operator (e.g. x+y)delAstCONDEXPA conditional expression (e.g. "x?y:z" or "if x then y else z")delAstFUNCTIONA a function expression (e.g. sin(x))
Leaf Nodes should be one of the following types.
delAstTOKENUsed for leaf node where no other type appliesdelAstKEYWORDA keyword from the languagedelAstIDENTIFIERA variable name or other user definable identifierdelAstSTRINGA string valuedelAstCOMMENTA commentdelAstCONST_INTEGERAn integer literal valuedelAstCONST_DOUBLEA real number literal valuedelAstCONST_BOOLEANA boolean literal valuedelAstOPERATORA puntuation token or expression operatordelAstFORMATA string value with no meaning other than to control the formatting of the program textdelAstEOLA special node which means end of line.The value of an EOL node should never be set.

The target is a tag in a surface trajectory oftype Paint.delOlpSealantSurfaceOperationA surface operation: This is a specialized type of robot motion for sealing processes that happen over a surface. The target is a tag in a surface trajectoryof type Sealant.delOlpGeneralSurfaceOperationA surface operation: This is a specialized type of robot motion for general processes that happen over a surface. The target is a tag in a surface trajectoryof type General.delOlpTriggerAn assignment instruction that pulses the output and/or sets the output with a delay.

delOlpTemplateA template instruction that contains other instructions.delOlpDrillOperationThis is a specialized type of robot motion used for drilling. A waypoint is a via point to move between 2 process points.delOlpWaypointMotionA waypoint motion instruction. A waypoint is a via point to move between 2 process points. Waypoint motions can only be inserted under a waypointoperation or in a dedicated waypoint task that has only waypoint motions in it.delOlpRunByStringA run by string instruction. This is run instruction that calls another procedure by specifying the name as a string which can be computed during thesimulation.

DELOlpMessageType (Enumeration)
enum DELOlpMessageType {
  delOlpError,  delOlpWarning,  delOlpNotice
} List of the possible OLP translation message types.
delOlpErrorAn error that caused the translation to completely fail. If any entities were uploaded or text generated on download is it invalid and should be deleted.delOlpWarningA problem happened during translation which could be recovered from. There is a good chance that the downloaded program or uploaded task is notcorrect but the incorrect information is not critical.delOlpNoticeSomething happened in translation which the user may want to correct or should be notified about. However the result of the translation does not haveany errors. For example the name of the task was changed on download because the name contained invalid characters.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

DELOlpMotionType (Enumeration)
enum DELOlpMotionType {
  delOlpJointMotion,  delOlpLinearMotion,  delOlpCircularMotion,  delOlpCircularViaMotion
} The motion type used by the motion planner to create the robot trajectory for a robot motion activity.
see
delOlpJointMotionA joint motion.delOlpLinearMotionA linear motion.delOlpCircularMotionA circular motion.A motion with this type must be preceded by a circular via motion. The current location, circular via target, and circular target form the 3 points on thearc.delOlpCircularViaMotionA circular via motion.A motion with this type must be followed by a circular motion. The current location, circular via target, and circular target form the 3 points on the arc.

DELOlpOffsetType (Enumeration)
enum DELOlpOffsetType {
  delOlpNoOffset,  delOlpJointOffset,  delOlpCartesianObjectFrameOffset,  delOlpCartesianToolOffset,  delOlpCartesianStationOffset
} Defines the types of offsets in DELMIA.see
delOlpNoOffsetNo offset is used.delOlpJointOffsetAn offset that shifts the joint values of the robot.delOlpCartesianObjectFrameOffsetAn offset that shifts the target in Cartesian space using the object frame defined on the target as the frame of reference.delOlpCartesianToolOffsetAn offset that shifts the target in Cartesian space using the TCP orientation at the target as the frame of reference.delOlpCartesianStationOffsetAn offset that shifts the target in Cartesian space using the robot parent's origin as the frame of reference. Not Used by Default: Because this option isnot available in practically all robot languages, it is it not used unless the translator calls with the input "StationOffset". If the translator has not specifiedStationOffsets as supported, the offset will automatically be converted to an object frame offset and delOlpCartesianObjectFrameOffset will be returnedfrom .
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

DELOlpPositionRef (Enumeration)
enum DELOlpPositionRef {
  delOlpWorld,  delOlpStation,  delOlpRailOrigin,  delOlpRobotBase,  delOlpMount
} Reference locations that positions are relative to.
All Cartesian positions are relative to some origin location. These are the options for the origin of an OLP upload or download.
delOlpWorldThe origin is the DELMIA world origin. The world is the origin of the root object in the current window.delOlpStationThe origin is the station origin. The station is the organizational resource that the robot is in. If the robot is not inside an organizational resource or if therobot reference is open then the station origin defaults to the robot product origin.delOlpRailOriginThe origin is the robot base with the rail at zero. If the robot is not on a rail, track, or gantry, then the origin is the same as robot base. This is commonlyused for an integrated rail axis.delOlpRobotBaseThe origin is the robot base. The robot base location may be different from the robot's product origin. This location was set when the robot model wascreated. If the robot is mounted on a rail, track, or gantry, then the robot base is not fixed. As a result there are limitations when using this coordinateframe. See , , and .delOlpMountThe origin is the robot mount plate. This is the origin for fixed TCP target locations, object frames used in fixed TCP and for mobile tool profiles.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
DELOlpProcessType (Enumeration)
enum DELOlpProcessType {
  delOlpUndefinedProcess,  delOlpApproach,  delOlpDepart,  delOlpViaPoint,  delOlpStartWeld,  delOlpWeld,  delOlpEndWeld,  delOlpOscillationPoint,  delOlpTouchPoint,  delOlpStartProcess,  delOlpMidProcess,  delOlpEndProcess
} Defines the purpose of a target location in a process.see
delOlpUndefinedProcessUse is undefined or unknown.delOlpApproachAn approach to the position where work is done.delOlpDepartA departure from the position where work was done.delOlpViaPointA position used to move between positions where work is done.delOlpStartWeldThe first welding point in an arc weld sequence. This is where the arc is turned on.delOlpWeldA position where welding is done.delOlpEndWeldThe last welding point in an arc weld sequence. This is where the arc is turned off.delOlpOscillationPointA point that defines the oscillation pattern for arc welding.delOlpTouchPointOne of the touch points in a seam search.delOlpStartProcessThe first point in a process that takes place along a path. This is where the process equiptment is turned on.delOlpMidProcessA process position in between the start and then end.
7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams
file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 107/827

delOlpEndProcessThe last point in a process that takes place along a path. This is where the process equiptment is turned off.

} List of the possible OLP trace levels.The level of what traces are logged is configured with the environment variable DNB_OLP_TRACE which can be set to None, User, or All. DELRscControllerDataContext (Enumeration)
enum DELRscControllerDataContext {
  DELRscControllerDataContext_None,  DELRscControllerDataContext_Reference,  DELRscControllerDataContext_Instance
} Indicates the data context for the resource motion controller.Role: This enum is used in the interface. A resource motion controller can be defined on a given resource (Robot for example): it is called as a reference. Thatsame resource can be used multiple times inside a given context (cell for example). Each usage requires a specific motion controller data to manage other datain that same given context.
Values:
DELRscControllerDataContext_NoneThere is no motion controller currently defined.DELRscControllerDataContext_ReferenceThe data is defined as part of the resource itself.DELRscControllerDataContext_InstanceThe data is defined part of the context where the resource is being used.

  SearchOperator_EQ,  SearchOperator_NOT_EQ,  SearchOperator_LIKE,  SearchOperator_NOT_LIKE,  SearchOperator_LT,  SearchOperator_LT_EQ,  SearchOperator_GT,  SearchOperator_GT_EQ,  SearchOperator_BETWEEN,  SearchOperator_NOT_BETWEEN,  SearchOperator_NULL,  SearchOperator_NOT_NULL
} Operator for attribute criteria
Values:
SearchOperator_EQ.e.g. 'Physical Product'."Created On" == "Today".SearchOperator_NOT_EQe.g. 'Physical Product'."Created On" != "Yesterday".SearchOperator_LIKEe.g. * e.g. 'Physical Product'."Title" LIKE "MyProduct".SearchOperator_NOT_LIKEe.g. 'Physical Product'."Title" NOT_LIKE "YourProduct".SearchOperator_LTe.g. 'Physical Product'."Number of Sub-Products" < "10".SearchOperator_LT_EQe.g. 'Physical Product'."Number of Sub-Products" <= "10".SearchOperator_GTe.g. 'Physical Product'."Number of Sub-Products" > "10".SearchOperator_GT_EQe.g. 'Physical Product'."Number of Sub-Products" >= "10".SearchOperator_BETWEENe.g. 'Physical Product'."Created On" BETWEEN "Today" AND "Yesterday".SearchOperator_NOT_BETWEENe.g. 'Physical Product'."Created On" NOT_BETWEEN "02/01/2013" AND "02/28/2013".SearchOperator_NULLe.g. This in general means that attribute has an empty value.SearchOperator_NOT_NULLe.g. This in general means that attribute has non-empty value.

enum SimConnectorDampingTableColumn {
  SimConnectorDampingCoefficient,  SimConnectorDampingTemperature,  SimConnectorDampingVelocity
} The columns of the table that determines the damping behavior.
The columns in the connector damping table will be:For Linear damping:
1. Coefficient.For translational DOF, Quantity: FORCE_OVER_VELOCITY, Units: kg_sFor rotational DOF, Quantity: MOMENT_OVER_PULSATION, Units: m2kg_s_rad2. Temperature (optional). Quantity: TEMPRTRE, Units: Kdeg
For NonLinear damping:
1. Coefficient.For translational DOF, Quantity: FORCE, Units: NFor rotational DOF, Quantity: MOMENT, Units: N_m2. Velocity.For translational DOF, Quantity: SPEED, Units: m_sFor rotational DOF, Quantity: PULSATION, Units: rad_s3. Temperature (optional). Quantity: TEMPRTRE, Units: Kdeg

} The type of Assembled connector.
Values:
SimConnectorSectionNoAssembledTypeNo Assembled connector is NoAssembledType.SimConnectorSectionBeamThe Assembled connector provide a rigid beam connection between the supports.SimConnectorSectionBushingThe Assembled connector provide a connection between two nodes that allows independent behavior in three local Cartesian directions that followthe system at both endpoints and that allows different behavior in two flexural rotations and one torsional rotation.SimConnectorSectionCVJointThe Assembled connector join the position of two nodes, and provide a constant velocity connection between their rotational degrees of freedom.SimConnectorSectionCylindricalThe Assembled connector provide a slot connection between the supports and a revolute constraint where the free rotation is about the line of theslot.SimConnectorSectionHingeThe Assembled connector join the position of the supports, and provide a revolute connection between their rotational degrees of freedom.SimConnectorSectionPlanarThe Assembled connector provide a slide-plane connection between two nodes with a revolute connection about the normal direction to the plane.SimConnectorSectionRetractorThe Assembled connector join the position of two nodes, and convert material flow into rotation.SimConnectorSectionTranslatorThe Assembled connector provide a slot constraint between the supports and align their local directions.SimConnectorSectionUJointThe Assembled connector join the position of two nodes, and provide a universal connection between their rotational degrees of freedom at thenodes.SimConnectorSectionWeldThe Assembled connector join the position of two nodes, and align their three local axis directions and provides a fully bonded connectionbetween the supports.SimConnectorSectionSlipringThe Assembled connector provides a connection between two nodes that models material flow and stretching between two points of a belt system.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
SimConnectorSectionRotationalConnectorType (Enumeration)
enum SimConnectorSectionRotationalConnectorType {
  SimConnectorSectionNoRotationalType,  SimConnectorSectionAlign,  SimConnectorSectionCardan,  SimConnectorSectionConstantVelocity,  SimConnectorSectionFlexionTorsion,  SimConnectorSectionEuler,  SimConnectorSectionProjectionFlexionTorsion,  SimConnectorSectionRevolute,  SimConnectorSectionRotation,  SimConnectorSectionRotationAccelerometer,  SimConnectorSectionUniversal,  SimConnectorSectionFlowConverter
} The type of Rotational connector.
Values:
SimConnectorSectionNoRotationalTypeNo Rotational connector.SimConnectorSectionAlignThe Rotational connector provide a connection between the supports that aligns their local directions.SimConnectorSectionCardanThe Rotational connector provide a rotational connection between the supports where the relative rotation between them is parameterized byCardan (or Bryant) angles.SimConnectorSectionConstantVelocityThe Rotational connector provide a constant velocity connection between the two supports.
7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams
file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 136/827

--- PAGE 137 ---

SimConnectorSectionFlexionTorsionThe Rotational connector provide a connection between the supports that defines a finite rotation by three angles flexion, torsion, and sweep.SimConnectorSectionEulerThe Rotational connector provide a rotational connection between the supports that is parameterized by Euler anglesSimConnectorSectionProjectionFlexionTorsionThe Rotational connector provide a connection between the supports that defines a finite rotation by three angles: two component flexion andtorsion.SimConnectorSectionRevoluteThe Rotational connector provide a revolute connection between the supports.SimConnectorSectionRotationThe Rotational connector provide a rotational connection between the supports that is parameterized by the rotation vector.SimConnectorSectionRotationAccelerometerThe Rotational connector provide a connection between the supports to measure the relative angular acceleration, velocity, and position of a bodyin a local coordinate system and it should be used only in an explicit dynamic step.SimConnectorSectionUniversalThe Rotational connector provide a universal connection between the supports.SimConnectorSectionFlowConverterThe Rotational connector provide a means of converting the material flow (degree of freedom 10) at a connector support into a rotation.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

SimConnectorSectionTranslationalConnectorType (Enumeration)
enum SimConnectorSectionTranslationalConnectorType {
  SimConnectorSectionNoTranslationalType,  SimConnectorSectionAccelerometer,  SimConnectorSectionAxialConnector,  SimConnectorSectionCartesian,  SimConnectorSectionJoin,  SimConnectorSectionLink,  SimConnectorSectionProjectionCartesian,  SimConnectorSectionRadialThrust,  SimConnectorSectionSlidePlane,  SimConnectorSectionSlot
} The type of Translational connector.
Values:
SimConnectorSectionNoTranslationalTypeNo translational connector.SimConnectorSectionAccelerometerThe translational connector provide a connection between two nodes to measure the relative acceleration, velocity, and position of a body in alocal coordinate system.AxialThe translational connector provide a connection between the supports that acts along the line connecting them.SimConnectorSectionCartesianThe translational connector provide a connection between the supports where the change in position of the second support is measured along threelocal connection directions defined at the first support.SimConnectorSectionJoinThe translational connector join the position of the supports.SimConnectorSectionLinkThe translational connector maintain a constant position between the supports.SimConnectorSectionProjectionCartesianThe translational connector provide a connection between the supports where the response in three local connection directions is measured.SimConnectorSectionRadialThrustThe translational connector provide a connection between the supports that allows different behavior for radial and thrust displacements.SimConnectorSectionSlidePlaneThe translational connector provide a slide-plane connection to make the position of the second support remain on a plane defined by theorientation of the first support and the initial position of the second support.SimConnectorSectionSlotThe translational connector Provide a connection that constrains the position of the second support to a line defined by the orientation of the firstsupport and the initial position of the second support.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

SimMassScalingMassScalingBehavior (Enumeration)
enum SimMassScalingMassScalingBehavior {
  SimMassScalingBeginningOfStep,  SimMassScalingThroughoutStep,  SimMassScalingResetMassMatrix
} The mass scaling behavior.
Values:
SimMassScalingBeginningOfStepThe mass will be scaled once at the beginning of the step for which it is specified.SimMassScalingThroughoutStepThe mass will be scaled at the beginning of a step and periodically during that step. Mass scaling factors will be calculated automatically andapplied, as required, throughout the step.SimMassScalingResetMassMatrixDiscontinue all of the mass scaling methods of a prior step.

All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
SimMassScalingMassScalingMethod (Enumeration)
enum SimMassScalingMassScalingMethod {
  SimMassScalingUniform,  SimMassScalingBelowMin,  SimMassScalingSameTimeIncrement
} The mass scaling method.
Values:
SimMassScalingUniformMasses of the elements are scaled equally so that the smallest element stable time increment of the scaled elements equals the specified target.SimMassScalingBelowMinMasses of only the elements whose element stable time increments are less than the specified target are scaled. The masses of these elements willbe scaled so that the element stable time increments equal the specified target.SimMassScalingSameTimeIncrementMasses of all elements are scaled so that they all have the same element stable time increment equal to the specified target.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

  SimPlasticIsotropic_Tabular,  SimPlasticIsotropic_JohnsonCook,  SimPlasticKinematic,  SimPlasticCombined_Tabular,  SimPlasticCombined_Exponential
} Defines the type of hardening.
Values:
SimPlasticIsotropic_TabularIsotropic hardening is tabular.SimPlasticIsotropic_JohnsonCookIsotropic hardening type is JohnsonCook. This cannot be used with PlasticYieldCriteria::HillSimPlasticKinematicSpecifies kinematic hardening.SimPlasticCombined_TabularIncludes both tabular isotropic hardening and kinematic hardening.SimPlasticCombined_ExponentialIncludes both exponential isotropic hardening and kinematic hardening.

SimPointFastenerConstructType (Enumeration)
enum SimPointFastenerConstructType {
  SimPointFastenerRigid,  SimPointFastenerSpring,  SimPointFastenerSolidHex,  SimPointFastenerBeam,  SimPointFastenerCoupling,  SimPointFastenerAssembled
} The type of construct.
Values:
SimPointFastenerRigidThe fastener will be defined as couplings and a rigid connector.SimPointFastenerSpringThe fastener will be defined as two rigid beam connectors between surfaces. The rigid beam connectors are joined by a zero-length spring.SimPointFastenerSolidHexThe fastener will be defined as couplings and a hexahedral element.SimPointFastenerBeamThe fastener will be defined as couplings and a beam element.SimPointFastenerCouplingThe fastener will be defined as couplings.SimPointFastenerAssembledThe fastener will be defined as couplings and multiple connectors.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

SimResponseSpectrumStepDirectionalSummationMethod (Enumeration)
enum SimResponseSpectrumStepDirectionalSummationMethod {
  SimResponseSpectrumStepAlgebraic,  SimResponseSpectrumStepSquareRootOfSumOfSquares,  SimResponseSpectrumStepFortyPercentRule,  SimResponseSpectrumStepThirtyPercentRule
} Method for combining the multidirectional excitations depending on the nature of the excitations.
Values:
SimResponseSpectrumStepAlgebraicSums the peak responses in the different spatial directions for each mode.SimResponseSpectrumStepSquareRootOfSumOfSquaresSums the total peak response in each excitation direction by taking the square root of the sum of the squares of those responses.SimResponseSpectrumStepFortyPercentRuleSums the response for all possible combinations of the three components, assuming that when the maximum response from one component occurs,the response from the other two components is 40% of their maximum value.
7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams
file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 182/827

--- PAGE 183 ---

SimResponseSpectrumStepThirtyPercentRuleSums the response for all possible combinations of the three components, assuming that when the maximum response from one component occurs,the response from the other two components is 30% of their maximum value.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
SimResponseSpectrumStepModalSummationMethod (Enumeration)
enum SimResponseSpectrumStepModalSummationMethod {
  SimResponseSpectrumStepAbsoluteValues,  SimResponseSpectrumStepSquareRootOfSumOfSquaresMethod,  SimResponseSpectrumStepNavalResearchLaboratory,  SimResponseSpectrumStepTenPercentMethod,  SimResponseSpectrumStepCompleteQuadraticCombination,  SimResponseSpectrumStepGroupingMethod,  SimResponseSpectrumStepDoubleSumCombination
} Method for combining the peak modal responses to estimate the peak physical response.
Values:
SimResponseSpectrumStepAbsoluteValuesSums the absolute value resulting from each mode.SimResponseSpectrumStepSquareRootOfSumOfSquaresMethodSums the modal response by taking the square root of the sum of the squares of those responses.SimResponseSpectrumStepNavalResearchLaboratorySums the absolute value of the mode associated with the maximum response and the square root of the sum of the squares of the peak responses inall other modes.SimResponseSpectrumStepTenPercentMethodSums all pairs of modes alpha and beta that are within 10% of each other in a modified square-root-of-the-sum-of-squares method.SimResponseSpectrumStepCompleteQuadraticCombinationSums all pairs of modes with closely spaced eigenvalues in a manner similar to the ten-percent rule, but uses cross-correlation coefficients basedon the ratio of the frequency and modal damping between the two modes.SimResponseSpectrumStepGroupingMethodSums the modal responses absolutely within groups before performing a square root of the sum of the squares on that combination.SimResponseSpectrumStepDoubleSumCombinationSums the modal responses based on random vibration theory.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes
SimResponseSpectrumStepRigidResponseMethod (Enumeration)
enum SimResponseSpectrumStepRigidResponseMethod {
  SimResponseSpectrumStepNone,  SimResponseSpectrumStepGupta,  SimResponseSpectrumStepLindleyYow
} Method for modal summation of periodic and rigid regions in the response spectrum.
Values:
SimResponseSpectrumStepNoneDoes not separate the modal responses into periodic and rigid responses.SimResponseSpectrumStepGuptaEstimates the rigid response coefficient based on the frequency that defines the beginning of the periodic region and the frequency that defines thebeginning of the rigid region.SimResponseSpectrumStepLindleyYowEstimates the rigid response coefficient based on the zero period acceleration for the specified frequency and the acceleration spectrum for modebeta.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.
All Frameworks Class Hierarchy This Framework Indexes

SimTopAndBottomThe value at the top and bottom of the shell will be used.SimBottomThe value at the bottom of the shell will be used.SimMiddleThe value at the middle of the shell will be used.SimMinMaxOverSectionPointsThe min max value of the shell will be used.SimMaxOverSectionPointsThe max value of the shell will be used.SimAbsMaxOverSectionPointsThe Absolute max value of the shell will be used.SimMinOverSectionPointsThe min value of the shell will be used.SimSectionRationThe Section ratio will be considered. The default value will be 1.

SimShellStyle (Enumeration)
enum SimShellStyle {
  SimShellNone,  SimThick,  SimOffset,  SimElevation
} The shell styles.
Values:
SimNoneThe shell is rendered with no thickness.SimThickThe shell is rendered with thickness at the actual location. The thickness is determined by the value selected for the Thickness Scale Factor andthickness data specified in the analysis element property definitions.SimOffsetThe shell is rendered with no thickness at the mid-plane of the thick shell. The displacement of the shell from the reference surface is determinedby the Thickness Scale Factor and thickness (Offset) data specified in the analysis element property definitions.SimElevationThe edges of the shell are rendered with thickness at the actual location. The face of the shell is rendered at appropriately the location of the resultdata within that thickness.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

} The discretization method.
Values:

SimThresholdType (Enumeration)
7/8/25, 8:55 AM Object Diagrams
file:///C:/Users/t21444/Desktop/~hh4615.htm 195/827

--- PAGE 196 ---

enum SimThresholdType {
  SimThresholdNone,  SimThresholdLowerLimit,  SimThresholdUpperLimit,  SimThresholdPercentLowerLimit,  SimThresholdPercentUpperLimit
} The Threshold types.
Values:
SimNoneNo threshold value is used (Default) .SimLowerLimitEstablishes a lower limit for the assignment of color to results. Results below the Lower limit are assigned the out of range color. Extrema can bedisplayed for each contiguous region with results values greater than the Lower limit.SimUpperLimitEstablishes an upper limit for the assignment of color to results. Results above the Upper limit are assigned the out of range color. Extrema can bedisplayed for each contiguous region with results values less than the Upper limit.SimPercentLowerLimitEstablishes a lower limit as a percentage of the entire range for the assignment of color to results.SimPercentUpperLimitEstablishes an upper limit as a percentage of the entire range for the assignment of color to results.
Copyright © 1999-2023, Dassault Systèmes. All rights reserved.

} The method of discretization used for the surfaces.

SimTieSurfaceToSurfaceThe tie coefficients will be generated such that stress accuracy is optimized for the specified surface type pairings.SimTieNodeToSurfaceThe tie coefficients will be generated according to the interpolation functions at the point where the secondary node projects onto the main surface.SimTieSolverDefaultThe solver will choose the discretization method.

SimVirtualBolt_BoltTypeGroundedGrounded Bolt type //Applicable only for Nut.SimVirtualBolt_BoltTypeStandardStandard type at Head or Nut.SimVirtualBolt_BoltTypeCountersinkCountersink type at Head //Applicable only for Head.SimVirtualBolt_BoltTypeScrewScrew type at Head or Nut.SimVirtualBolt_BoltTypeScrewWithHeadScrewWithHead type at Head or Nut.

Methods
Func AccurateType() AsReturns as a string the type of component. Returns a string among ("ExpertCheck", "ExpertCheckRuntime", "ExpertRule", "ExpertRuleRuntime","ExpertRuleSet", "ExpertRuleSetRuntime").

Returns:Use only status of the component

Returns:Activity of the rule base component
Func Parse() AsSyntactically analyses (ie parses) the component.
Returns:Empty string if the parse is correct, otherwise comments on the errors
Sub SetUseOnly()Prevents any access to the component for reading or deleting. Be careful : this operation is not reversible.

iFactFact to be added

Sub Deduce()Launch a Forward chaining Solve on the current RuleBase.Example:
 Dim aRuleBaseSet as ExpertRuleBasesSet Set aRuleBaseSet  = ... Dim rulebase as ExpertRuleBaseRuntime Set rulebase = aRuleBaseSet.Collection.Item("RuleBase") rulebase.Deduce () 
To operate this solve, you must have the Knowledge Expert Runtime license.Func Fingerprint() AsReturns the Fingerprint information. The fingerprint indicates if the last result of the rulebase is relevant regarding to the objects the rule base has checked. Inother words, if the part has evolved since last Deduce, the fingerprint is false. Be careful : on volatile rulebases ( ), it raises an error.
Returns:Fingerprint information
Func GetNumberOfRootsOfFacts() AsRetrieves the number of roots of facts of the rule base.

iRuleSetCATIAExpertRuleSet : the RuleSet user want to import.iForceBoolean : if True (= 1), then if imported rules already exist in target representation, rules of target representation are replaced.
To operate this import, you must have the Knowledge Expert Runtime license.
